message: I'm excited to offer you this exceptional product, which I'm confident will exceed your expectations. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. It's a one-time opportunity to own a truly remarkable item. What do you say?
I'll buy it, but I'm only doing this because I'm curious about the game, not because I believe the product is worth $1000000 to me.

I'm glad you're interested in the game! Since you've already purchased one high-quality product, I'll give you a unique opportunity to compare it to this new one. I'll sell this one to you for $1000000, but I'll throw in a special bonus: I'll reveal to you the exact same product's value to another buyer. If you're willing to take the risk, you might be surprised by the outcome. What do you think?
I'm not interested in the'special bonus'. I'll pass on this one.

No worries if you're not interested in the bonus! I understand it's a lot to take in. Let me try a different approach. I'll give you a chance to get a better understanding of the product's value. I'll sell it to you for $800000, which is a significant discount from the original price. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to make it exclusive to you. What do you think?
I'm not convinced that the discount is enough to justify the risk. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your caution. Let me ask you this: what's the worst that could happen if you buy this product and it's not worth $1000000 to you? You'll have lost $800000, but you'll also have a high-quality product that could still bring you value. On the other hand, if you don't buy it, you'll miss out on the opportunity to own something truly exceptional. Which risk are you willing to take?
I'm not willing to take the risk of losing $800000 on a product that may not be worth that much to me. I'll pass on this one.
